Medicine_tweet_63.News Finding: Using your mobile phone during #pregnancy is unlikely to cause adverse neurodevelopmental effects  #bmcpublichealth
Medicine_tweet_63.Paper Finding: Our unique findings do not support the hypothesis of adverse effects on children's language, communication and motor skills due to maternal cell phone use during gestation.
Medicine_tweet_63.News Context: Using your mobile phone during #pregnancy is unlikely to cause adverse neurodevelopmental effects  #bmcpublichealth
Medicine_tweet_63.Paper Context: These associations were confirmed by dose-response trends, even after excluding non-users. Our unique findings do not support the hypothesis of adverse effects on children's language, communication and motor skills due to maternal cell phone use during gestation. Nevertheless, in the Spanish study cell phone users had children who scored higher in the Bayley mental scale and in the Danish study there was a trend for lower risk for cognitive/language delay at 6 months [ .
Medicine_tweet_63.text:

Paper Finding: Our unique findings do not support the hypothesis of adverse effects on children\'s language, communication and motor skills due to maternal cell phone use during gestation.']

Medicine_tweet_159.News Finding: P. gingivalis linked to esophageal cancer.
Medicine_tweet_159.Paper Finding: While the presence of P. gingivalis was not significantly associated with age, gender, or smoking history of the patients, the presence of P. gingivalis was positively related to differentiation, lymph node metastasis and the TNM stage of ESCC (p < 0.05).
Medicine_tweet_159.News Context: P. gingivalis linked to esophageal cancer.
Medicine_tweet_159.Paper Context: If we set the samples with IHC scores more than 1 as P. gingivalis positive, the sensitivity and specificity of IHC would be 94.3 and 96.6 %, respectively (Kappa = 0.882; p < 0.001, Additional file 2: Table S1), showing excellence concordance between IHC and qRT-PCR for the detection of P. gingivalis infection in the cancerous tissues of ESCC patients. While the presence of P. gingivalis was not significantly associated with age, gender, or smoking history of the patients, the presence of P. gingivalis was positively related to differentiation, lymph node metastasis and the TNM stage of ESCC (p < 0.05). A positive immunohistochemical signal for P. gingivalis was 90 % in the poorly differentiated tissues, which was significantly higher than that of well or moderately differentiated samples (p < 0.05) ( Table 5) .
Medicine_tweet_159.text:
['Reported Finding: P. gingivalis linked to esophageal cancer.
Paper Finding: While the presence of P. gingivalis was not significantly associated with age, gender, or smoking history of the patients, the presence of P. gingivalis was positively related to differentiation, lymph node metastasis and the TNM stage of ESCC (p < 0.05).']
Medicine_tweet_159.displayed_text:
Reported Finding: P. gingivalis linked to esophageal cancer.
Paper Finding: While the presence of P. gingivalis was not significantly associated with age, gender, or smoking history of the patients, the presence of P. gingivalis was positively related to differentiation, lymph node metastasis and the TNM stage of ESCC (p < 0.05).

Medicine_tweet_150.News Finding: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes
Medicine_tweet_150.Paper Finding: Our study suggests that long-chain omega-3 fatty acids may provide protection to the b-cell after clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_150.News Context: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes
Medicine_tweet_150.Paper Context: However, significantly reduced risk of development of islet autoimmunity was associated with increased intake of omega-3 fatty acids among youth genetically susceptible to development of type 1 diabetes (36), although continued follow-up did not reveal subsequent protection against incident type 1 diabetes (37). Our study suggests that long-chain omega-3 fatty acids may provide protection to the b-cell after clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes. Our results support further study of the potential role of branched-chain amino acids to enhance sustained insulin production in type 1 diabetes.
Medicine_tweet_150.text:
['Reported Finding: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes
Paper Finding: Our study suggests that long-chain omega-3 fatty acids may provide protection to the b-cell after clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes.']
Medicine_tweet_150.displayed_text:
Reported Finding: Diet rich in omega 3 (best source = oily fish) could help preserve pancreatic function for kids with T1 #diabetes
Paper Finding: Our study suggests that long-chain omega-3 fatty acids may provide protection to the b-cell after clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes.

Medicine_tweet_28.News Finding: Lower results on IQ tests are associated with higher consumption of alcohol.
Medicine_tweet_28.Paper Finding: They found a J-shaped association between frequency of drinking and IQ test results, where the daily drinkers had the lowest IQ.
Medicine_tweet_28.News Context: Lower results on IQ tests are associated with higher consumption of alcohol.
Medicine_tweet_28.Paper Context: It should be noted that the authors report a skewed study population with regard to low socioeconomic position . They found a J-shaped association between frequency of drinking and IQ test results, where the daily drinkers had the lowest IQ. A higher IQ was associated with being a rare, an occasional, and a moderate drinker, whereas there was a lower IQ for being a former drinker compared with being a lifetime abstainer.
Medicine_tweet_28.text:
['Reported Finding: Lower results on IQ tests are associated with higher consumption of alcohol.
Paper Finding: They found a J-shaped association between frequency of drinking and IQ test results, where the daily drinkers had the lowest IQ.']
Medicine_tweet_28.displayed_text:
Reported Finding: Lower results on IQ tests are associated with higher consumption of alcohol.
Paper Finding: They found a J-shaped association between frequency of drinking and IQ test results, where the daily drinkers had the lowest IQ.
